decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overpower opponents. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of threats to keep pressure on the opponent, while also using removal spells to deal with any problematic blockers. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Hazoret the Fervent and Glorybringer allows for high damage output and closing out games quickly. Additionally, the deck includes mana-efficient creatures like Bomat Courier and Scrapheap Scrounger to maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Hazoret the Fervent, Glorybringer, and Rekindling Phoenix, along with efficient removal spells such as Magma Spray and Abrade to maintain control of the board. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a steady stream of threats to keep the opponent on the back foot, ultimately securing a victory through a combination of direct damage and combat superiority.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With a mix of control spells like Syncopate, Censor, and Vraska's Contempt, along with card draw from Champion of Wits and Hieroglyphic Illumination, the deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check while maintaining card advantage. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk and The Scarab God to close out the game once it has stabilized. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Hazoret the Fervent, and Goblin Chainwhirler, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. With a low mana curve and a focus on direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Wizard's Lightning, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Bomat Courier and Kari Zev, Skyship Raider provide card advantage and evasion, respectively, to keep the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to dominate the board. The key strategy is to stall the opponent's threats while building up to powerful win conditions like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Karn, Scion of Urza. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures like Walking Ballista and Heart of Kiran to apply pressure and close out the game. By managing the board state and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The deck focuses on generating massive card draw and mana ramp to create a powerful board state quickly. By using artifacts and spells like Aetherflux Reservoir, Inspiring Statuary, and Sai, Master Thopterist, the deck can easily cast multiple spells in a turn and gain a significant advantage. The inclusion of Commit / Memory also provides a way to disrupt opponent's strategies while maintaining card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of artifacts and spells, ultimately leading to a game-winning combo.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while utilizing powerful threats like Torrential Gearhulk and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to close out the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plans, maintain card advantage, and maintain board control until it can establish a dominant position. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and keeping them off balance, ultimately winning through superior card advantage and resource management.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking opponents with a mix of powerful creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to quickly overwhelm opponents with low-cost creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler and Bomat Courier while using removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Abrade to maintain board control. Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer provide powerful threats that are difficult to deal with, and planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, Scion of Urza generate card advantage and additional pressure. The deck aims to maintain a fast-paced aggression to quickly defeat opponents before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using God-Pharaoh's Gift as a win condition by controlling the board with removal spells like Fumigate and Cast Out, while also utilizing creatures like Champion of Wits and Minister of Inquiries to dig through the deck. Refurbish is used to bring back God-Pharaoh's Gift from the graveyard, allowing for powerful reanimation plays. The deck also includes cards like Search for Azcanta and Chart a Course for card advantage and filtering. Overall, the strategy revolves around out-valuing the opponent and overwhelming them with powerful creatures.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and aggressive creatures like Kari Zev, Skyship Raider, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Hazoret the Fervent. It also includes powerful finishers like Glorybringer and Rekindling Phoenix to seal the deal. The deck's strategy revolves around dealing damage quickly and efficiently using burn spells like Magma Spray and Abrade to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, Scion of Urza provides additional value and card advantage to keep the pressure on the opponent.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence. It utilizes hand disruption with cards like Doomfall and Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, backed up by removal spells such as Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push. The deck also includes powerful creatures like The Scarab God and Torrential Gearhulk to apply pressure and close out the game. With versatile cards like Hostage Taker and Liliana, Death's Majesty, as well as some counter spells for protection, this deck aims to control the game while aggressively attacking the opponent.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays using efficient creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler and Rekindling Phoenix to quickly put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Glorybringer and Hazoret the Fervent to close out games. It utilizes burn spells like Magma Spray and Abrade to clear the path for its creatures, backed up by removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration. The deck also includes versatile threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Heart of Kiran to provide additional reach and value.

The main strategy of this deck is to aggressively play creatures like Bomat Courier, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Goblin Chainwhirler to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes burn spells like Magma Spray and Abrade to control the board and remove blockers. Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Hazoret the Fervent provide additional sources of damage and card advantage. The inclusion of Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer gives the deck powerful, evasive threats that can quickly close out games. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost and efficient creatures while also utilizing burn spells to clear the way and deal direct damage. The deck includes powerful threats like Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer, along with resilient creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger and Bomat Courier. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides card advantage and additional burn potential. The overall strategy is to maintain constant pressure on the opponent and finish them off before they can establish a strong defense.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on maintaining a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Knight of Malice and Knight of Grace, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Cast Out. The deck also includes powerful threats like Lyra Dawnbringer and Gideon of the Trials to close out the game quickly. History of Benalia provides additional creature tokens for added aggression. The inclusion of The Eldest Reborn and Ixalan's Binding helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ensuring the deck can maintain momentum and pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck focuses on removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt, countering key spells with Supreme Will and Essence Scatter, and generating advantage with Champion of Wits and The Scarab God. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent until it can close out the game with powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk and The Scarab God.
